Package becker.xtras.gasPump

Provides a graphical user interface (GUI) for a gas pump that uses three instances of a student-written class implementing the IMeter interface.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IMeter Objects implementing IMeter are used to measure the volume of fuel delivered to a customer at a gas pump.
 

Class Summary
DemoGasPump Run a demo for becker.xtras.gasPump using sample code that implements IMeter.
GasPumpGUI A graphical user interface to simulate a gas pump.
SampleMeter Measure the volume of fuel sold and calculate the amount owed by the customer, given the current fuel cost.
 

Package becker.xtras.gasPump Description

Provides a graphical user interface (GUI) for a gas pump that uses three instances of a student-written class implementing the IMeter interface. The GUI appears like this:

A typical main method to run this program would be

import becker.xtras.gasPump.*;

public class DemoGasPump extends Object
{
   public static void main(String[] args) 
   {  Meter silver = new Meter(0.819, 87, "Silver");
      Meter gold = new Meter(0.899, 89, "Gold");
      Meter platinum = new Meter(0.959, 93, "Platinum");
   
      GasPumpGUI gui = new GasPumpGUI(silver, gold, platinum);
   }    
}

where Meter is written by the student and implements the IMeter interface. The library includes an implementation of IMeter named SampleMeter. Substituting it for Meter in the above code will yield a working demonstration program.
